item.title: Jennifer add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Laurence Sterne
item.description: "What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything." -- Laurence Sterne

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ishmael Beah
item.description: "Some nights the sky wept stars that quickly floated and disappeared into the darkness before our wishes could meet them. " -- Ishmael Beah

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Elizabeth George Speare
item.description: "What a pity every child couldn't learn to read under a willow tree..." -- Elizabeth George Speare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Nadine Gordimer
item.description: "The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is." -- Nadine Gordimer

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?" -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "I got my heart's desire, and there my troubles began." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "Most people carry that pain around inside them their whole lives, until they kill the pain by other means, or until it kills them. But you, my friends, you found another way: a way to use the pain. To burn it as fuel, for light and warmth. You have learned to break the world that has tried to break you. " -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "That was the thing about the world: it wasn't that things were harder than you thought they were going to be, it was that they were hard in ways that you didn't expect." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description: "Most people are blind to magic. They move thru a blank and empty world. They’re bored with their lives and there’s nothing they can do about it. They’re eaten alive by longing and they’re dead before they die." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Louis C.K.
item.description: "I’m bored’ is a useless thing to say. I mean, you live in a great, big, vast world that you’ve seen none percent of. Even the inside of your own mind is endless; it goes on forever, inwardly, do you understand? The fact that you’re alive is amazing, so you don’t get to say ‘I’m bored." -- Louis C.K.

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Jordan
item.description: "Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?" -- Neil Jordan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "I suspect the truth is that we are waiting, all of us, against insurmountable odds, for something extraordinary to happen to us." -- Khaled Hosseini
